intro: Chaetopappa elegans, commonly known as the elegant chaetopappa, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has finely divided, silver-green leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
